en.title: PROJECT BLOOM
en.creditsDesc: Written by: David Dionisio Music from: Kevin Macleod Photos: Sahara (Kent Larsson), Road to the Isles (Trevor Wright), Similkameen River (Greg Shine, BLM), Costa Brava (Gordito1869), Puerto Rico (Oquendo)
en.toggleClimateHint: Climate zones help determine the general temperature of climates based on the latitude. Locations closer to the equator are hotter due to more direct sunlight.
en.levelMatchDesc: Find the location that matches the climate.
en.levelMatchNotFound: Climate does not match, try another location.
en.weatherSunnyDesc: Sun is visible for most of the day with few scattered clouds.
en.weatherPartlySunnyDesc: Less than half the sky is covered by clouds.
en.weatherMostlyCloudyDesc: Clouds cover the sky for more than 60%.
en.weatherCloudyDesc: Clouds cover almost all of the sky.
en.weatherLightRainDesc: A small amount of water accumulates from the rain over the day.
en.weatherRainDesc: A moderate amount of water accumulates from the rain over the day.
en.weatherOvercastDesc: Clouds cover the sky over 90%. The sun is practically invisible for the entire day.
en.weatherFogDesc: Clouds have formed at ground level, causing low visibility.
en.weatherHazeDesc: Particles of dusts hang over the air due to the gusts of wind, causing low visibility.
en.weatherSandstormDesc: Strong wind carries a dangerous amount of sand causing massive havoc, and low visibility.
en.weatherLightSnowDesc: A small amount of snow accumulates over the day. Low visibility is expected.
en.weatherSnowDesc: A moderate amount of snow accumulates over the day. Low visibility is expected.
en.weatherBlizzardDesc: A combination of strong wind, and freezing temperature. Falling large debris of ice is to be expected throughout the day.
en.unitAllyCollectorDesc: These frogs will be gathering water from a nearby source. Please protect them as they traverse the land!
en.unitAllyGardenerDesc: These frogs will tend to the garden to help grow the flowers, and rid them of pesky weeds.
en.unitAllyMalletDesc: Deploy these hardy frogs to crush pesky rodents from the ground.
en.unitAllySpearmanDesc: Deploy these frogs to fight against the pests that plague the sky.
en.unitAllySunflyDesc: These flies are capable of generating warmth to help flowers grow in cold weather, as well as melt ice.
en.unitAllyWindBlockerDesc: Deploy these frogs to protect the flowers from being blown away by dangerous wind.
en.climateTypeAridDesc: These climates are dry areas that receive little to no rain over a stretch of time. Not much vegetations can grow in these areas.
en.climateTypeContinentalDesc: Continental climates are found in regions away from the sea. They generally have four seasons: spring, summer, autumn, and winter.
en.climateTypeMarineWestCoastDesc: Oceanic (or Maritime) are influenced by ocean currents and are generally located next to the sea. The temperature range is fairly narrow, with cool summers and winters.
en.climateTypeMediterraneanDesc: Mediterranean climates are generally found in coastal regions, where the water is warm. The temperature is mild and musty.
en.climateTypePolarDesc: Arctic climate is defined by its long frigid winter, and short cool summer. They are at the very top and bottom of Earth where the sun barely shines.
en.climateTypeRainforestDesc: Rainforest climate is defined by its frequent rain, and high humidity. Because of this, these areas are dense with trees and vegetations.
en.locationOutbackDesc: The outback is located within Australia. Its biome consists of: tropical, savanna, and desert.
en.locationGreatPlainsDesc: The Great Plains is the broad flat lands in the middle of North America. Its biome is mostly made up of: prairie (flat grassy fields) and badlands (plateaus and canyons).
en.locationSaharaDesc: The Sahara is currently the largest hot desert in the world, located in North Africa. Its biome is predominantly a desert.
en.locationBritishIslesDesc: The British Isles are a group of islands located on the northwestern coast of Europe. Its biome is mostly that of a temperate forest.
en.locationPacificNorthwestDesc: The Pacific Northwest is a region of North America between the Pacific Ocean and the mountain range. Its biome mostly consists of a coniferous forest (pine and evergreen trees).
en.locationCostaBravaDesc: Located in the northeast coastal region of Spain. Its biome consists of: dry forest and scrubs.
en.locationGreenlandDesc: Greenland is the world’s largest island located in the North Atlantic Ocean. Its biome mostly consists of a tundra.
en.locationSiberiaDesc: Siberia is a vast region north of Russia. Its biome mostly consists of a snow forest (taiga).
en.locationBrazilDesc: Brazil is a country in the upper region of South America located next to the Atlantic Ocean. Its biome mostly consists of the Amazonian rainforest.
en.locationPuertoRicoDesc: Puerto Rico is a self-governed island associated with the United States located in the northeast Caribbean Sea. Its biome mostly consists of a rainforest.
en.intro01: Welcome to Project Bloom! We are conducting an experiment to grow some special flowers in various climates.
en.intro02: We need you to help train these fine capable frogs to nurture and protect the flowers.
en.tutorialLevelSelect01: This is a satellite map of Earth. Help us find a suitable location to land our seedling based on the target climate.
en.tutorialLevelSelect02: You can press the image of the climate to get more information.
en.tutorialDragInstruction: Drag the card towards the playing field.
en.tutorialWeatherInfo: Press any of the weather for more info!
en.level1Summary02: Weather describes the atmospheric condition in a region within a period of time: hour-to-hour, day-to-day.
en.level1Summary03: Climate describes the pattern of weather in a region over a long period of time: 30 years or more.
en.level2Summary02: Certain local areas can have a different pattern of weather than the main climate. This can be as small as a garden patch, or even a cave. As an example: a mountain or a hill can block the sunlight for most of the time, causing a cooler region.
en.level3Summary02: These are rare types of weather that can cause havoc across a region. Their atmospheric condition such as the wind and temperature are off the charts. Severe weathers are considered to be dangerous, and can put you in a perilous situation.
en.postGameDialog01: Now that we have enough climate data of Earth, we just need to verify their category on each climate zone.
en.postGameDialog02: You have been a great help, but we need you one more time to correctly match these climates.
en.intro_climate_continental_01: In continental climates, the temperature varies throughout the year.
en.intro_climate_continental_02: This is due to the region being within large landmasses far away from the oceans.
en.intro_climate_continental_03: Without the ocean to moderate the temperature, not much can stop the prevailing wind from being too hot, or too cold.
en.intro_climate_continental_04: In this scenario, we will be growing our plants during summer. Where it is mostly sunny, with some rain here and there. A pleasant weather to be out and about, and grow our plants!
en.intro_weather_01: Since we will be operating during summer, take note of the weather each day.
en.intro_weather_02: The weather describes the atmospheric condition of a region within a period of time: how cloudy, how humid, and is it going to rain?
en.intro_weather_03: Remember that the climate describes the weather pattern in a region annually across 30 years or more.
en.intro_weather_04: So the weather we will be experiencing here over a few days will be vastly different several months later.
en.weed_intro_01: Watch out! It looks like weeds are starting to grow near one of our plants!
en.weed_intro_02: Though the weather is ideal for our plants, unfortunately so it will be for these intrusive plants.
en.weed_intro_03: We must get rid of them, or else they will suck away all the nutrients that our plants need to grow!
en.mole_intro_01: A mole! These subterranean insectivores can be commonly found in continental climates, where the soil is ideal for making tunnels.
en.mole_intro_02: While moles don't have much interest in veggies, their tunneling however, can ruin a plant's roots.
en.mole_intro_03: Though they are essential in a healthy ecosystem, we don't want them near our plants!
en.beetle_intro_02: Though beetles almost eat anything, this one in particular seems to prefer eating plants.
en.beetle_intro_03: These insects thrive in most climates, so we will be seeing more of them later.
en.coolRainyAnnually: Cool and rainy most of the year.
en.intro_climate_oceanic_01: Ah, the oceanic climate! Where it’s nice and cool throughout the year!
en.intro_climate_oceanic_02: This is due to the region being close to the ocean that regulates the temperature.
en.intro_climate_oceanic_03: However, the winds carrying the nice ocean breeze can cause a lot of days to be dull and dreary.
en.intro_climate_oceanic_04: Nevertheless, this moody atmosphere is a perfect place to grow our plants!
en.intro_microclimate_01: Looks like we landed in a peculiar place where the weather is a little bit colder than usual.
en.intro_microclimate_02: This is known as a microclimate, where the local atmospheric condition can differ from the surrounding areas.
en.intro_microclimate_03: In our case, we are below the slope of a hill that obscures most of the sunlight, and precipitations linger around longer.
en.mushroom_intro_01: Uh oh, a mushroom started to grow near one of our plants!
en.mushroom_intro_02: Since there's a lot of moisture in the region, the fungi that grow these mushrooms are able to absorb a lot of nutrients.
en.mushroom_intro_03: Their spores appear to be harmful to all our frogs and plants, but one: the iron frog!
en.mushroom_intro_04: Deploy the iron frogs to rid us of these mushrooms.
en.intro_climate_desert_01: Oh boy, the desert climate...We sure took a wrong turn when we landed.
en.intro_climate_desert_02: This dry and hot weather will leave us with little to no water for our plants…and with dry soil, not much nutrients are available.
en.intro_climate_desert_03: However, there are oases nearby! This miracle of a microclimate will allow us to gather nutrients and water for our plants!
en.hopper_intro_02: These hopping hooligans can strive even in the hottest of climates, and they're no picky eaters either!
en.hopper_intro_03: These ones in particular have powerful hind legs that emit a dangerous wave that harms our frogs!
en.hopper_intro_04: Make sure to deploy any of these frogs to stop them in their tracks!
en.antlion_intro_01: An antlion larva has been spotted!
en.antlion_intro_02: These insects are commonly found in dry and sandy climates where they can easily excavate their pits.
en.antlion_intro_03: Our poor unsuspecting frogs will fall prey to these pits if left alone.
en.antlion_intro_04: Deploy the iron frog to plug away these troublesome pits for good!
en.hazard_weather_intro_01: Take cover, for there is a sand storm heading our way!
en.hazard_weather_intro_02: Every once in a while, in certain regions, a dangerous atmospheric condition occurs that can cause major destruction.
en.hazard_weather_intro_03: With proper equipment and knowledge of the weather pattern, one can properly prepare, and even avoid these severe weathers.
en.coldAnnually: Cold and freezing all year round.
en.intro_climate_polar_01: Brrrtz! This climate is as cold as it can get!
en.intro_climate_polar_02: Most of the regions under the polar climate are far away from the equator.
en.intro_climate_polar_03: Hence, the weather patterns consisting of cool summers and very cold winters.
en.intro_climate_polar_04: Only the sturdiest of plants can withstand this bitter cold. Luckily for us, we happen to have the right tools to allow our plants to grow.
en.intro_climate_polar_05: Now go forth, and grow the last batch of our plants!
en.dragClimateZone_instruction: Drag the climate types to the matching climate zones.

es.title: PROYECTO BLOOM
es.creditsDesc: Escrito por: David Dionisio Música de: Kevin Macleod Fotos: Sahara (Kent Larsson), Camino a las Islas (Trevor Wright), Río Similkameen (Greg Shine, BLM), Costa Brava (Gordito1869), Puerto Rico (Oquendo)
es.toggleClimateHint: Las zonas climáticas ayudan a determinar la temperatura general de los climas en función de la latitud. Las ubicaciones más cercanas al ecuador están más calientes debido a la luz solar más directa.
es.levelMatchDesc: Encuentra la ubicación que coincida con el clima.
es.levelMatchNotFound: El clima no coincide, prueba con otro lugar.
es.weatherSunnyDesc: El sol es visible durante la mayor parte del día con pocas nubes dispersas.
es.weatherPartlySunnyDesc: Menos de la mitad del cielo está cubierto de nubes.
es.weatherMostlyCloudyDesc: Las nubes cubren el cielo por más del 60%.
es.weatherCloudyDesc: Las nubes cubren casi todo el cielo.
es.weatherLightRainDesc: Una pequeña cantidad de agua se acumula de la lluvia durante el día.
es.weatherRainDesc: Una cantidad moderada de agua se acumula de la lluvia durante el día.
es.weatherOvercastDesc: Las nubes cubren el cielo más del 90%. El sol es prácticamente invisible durante todo el día.
es.weatherFogDesc: Las nubes se han formado a nivel del suelo, lo que provoca poca visibilidad.
es.weatherHazeDesc: Las partículas de polvo cuelgan sobre el aire debido a las ráfagas de viento, lo que provoca poca visibilidad.
es.weatherSandstormDesc: El viento fuerte lleva una peligrosa cantidad de arena causando estragos masivos y baja visibilidad.
es.weatherLightSnowDesc: Una pequeña cantidad de nieve se acumula a lo largo del día. Se espera una baja visibilidad.
es.weatherSnowDesc: A lo largo del día se acumula una cantidad moderada de nieve. Se espera una baja visibilidad.
es.weatherBlizzardDesc: Una combinación de viento fuerte y temperatura de congelación. Es de esperar que se caigan grandes restos de hielo durante todo el día.
es.unitAllyCollectorDesc: Estas ranas recolectarán agua de una fuente cercana. Por favor, protéjalos mientras atraviesan la tierra.
es.unitAllyGardenerDesc: Estas ranas atenderán al jardín para ayudar a cultivar las flores y librarlas de malezas molestas.
es.unitAllyMalletDesc: Despliega estas ranas resistentes para aplastar a molestos roedores del suelo.
es.unitAllySpearmanDesc: Despliega estas ranas para luchar contra las plagas que azotan el cielo.
es.unitAllySunflyDesc: Estas moscas son capaces de generar calor para ayudar a que las flores crezcan en climas fríos, así como derretir hielo.
es.unitAllyWindBlockerDesc: Despliega estas ranas para proteger las flores de la explosión del viento peligroso.
es.climateTypeAridDesc: Estos climas son áreas secas que reciben poca o ninguna lluvia durante un período de tiempo. No puede crecer mucha vegetación en estas áreas.
es.climateTypeContinentalDesc: Los climas continentales se encuentran en regiones alejadas del mar. Generalmente tienen cuatro estaciones: primavera, verano, otoño e invierno.
es.climateTypeMarineWestCoastDesc: Las corrientes oceánicas (o marítimas) están influenciadas por las corrientes oceánicas y generalmente se encuentran junto al mar. El rango de temperatura es bastante estrecho, con veranos e inviernos fríos.
es.climateTypeMediterraneanDesc: Los climas mediterráneos se encuentran generalmente en regiones costeras, donde el agua es cálida. La temperatura es suave y húmeda.
es.climateTypePolarDesc: El clima ártico se define por su largo invierno helado y su corto verano fresco. Están en la parte superior e inferior de la Tierra, donde el sol apenas brilla.
es.climateTypeRainforestDesc: El clima de la selva tropical se define por su frecuente lluvia y su alta humedad. Debido a esto, estas zonas son densas con árboles y vegetaciones.
es.locationOutbackDesc: El interior se encuentra dentro de Australia. Su bioma consiste en: tropical, sabana y desierto.
es.locationGreatPlainsDesc: Las Grandes Llanuras son las amplias tierras planas en el centro de América del Norte. Su bioma se compone principalmente de: praderas (campos de hierba plana) y tierras baldías (mesetas y cañones).
es.locationSaharaDesc: El Sahara es actualmente el desierto caliente más grande del mundo, ubicado en el norte de África. Su bioma es predominantemente un desierto.
es.locationBritishIslesDesc: Las Islas Británicas son un grupo de islas situadas en la costa noroeste de Europa. Su bioma es principalmente el de un bosque templado.
es.locationPacificNorthwestDesc: El noroeste del Pacífico es una región de América del Norte entre el Océano Pacífico y la cordillera. Su bioma consiste principalmente en un bosque de coníferas (pinos y árboles perennes).
es.locationCostaBravaDesc: Situado en la región costera noreste de España. Su bioma consiste en: bosque seco y matorrales.
es.locationGreenlandDesc: Groenlandia es la isla más grande del mundo ubicada en el Océano Atlántico Norte. Su bioma consiste principalmente en una tundra.
es.locationSiberiaDesc: Siberia es una vasta región al norte de Rusia. Su bioma consiste principalmente en un bosque nevado (taiga).
es.locationBrazilDesc: Brasil es un país de la región alta de Sudamérica situado junto al Océano Atlántico. Su bioma consiste principalmente en la selva amazónica.
es.locationPuertoRicoDesc: Puerto Rico es una isla autónoma asociada a los Estados Unidos situada en el noreste del mar Caribe. Su bioma consiste principalmente en una selva tropical.
es.intro01: ¡Bienvenido a Project Bloom! Estamos realizando un experimento para cultivar flores especiales en varios climas.
es.intro02: Te necesitamos para ayudar a entrenar estas finas ranas capaces de nutrir y proteger las flores.
es.tutorialLevelSelect01: Ésta es un mapa satelital de Tierra. Ayúdenos a encontrar un lugar adecuado para desembarcar nuestras plántulas según el clima objetivo.
es.tutorialLevelSelect02: Puede presionar la imagen del clima para obtener más información.
es.tutorialDragInstruction: Arrastra la carta hacia el campo de juego.
es.tutorialWeatherInfo: Presiona cualquier clima para obtener más información.
es.level1Summary02: El clima describe la condición atmosférica de una región dentro de un período de tiempo: hora a hora, día a día.
es.level1Summary03: El clima describe el patrón del clima en una región durante un largo período de tiempo: 30 años o más.
es.level2Summary02: Algunas zonas locales pueden tener un patrón de clima diferente al del clima principal. Esto puede ser tan pequeño como un parche de jardín o incluso una cueva. Por ejemplo: una montaña o una colina pueden bloquear la luz solar durante la mayor parte del tiempo, lo que provoca una región más fría.
es.level3Summary02: Estos son tipos raros de clima que pueden causar estragos en una región. Su estado atmosférico, como el viento y la temperatura, están fuera de las listas. Los climas severos se consideran peligrosos y pueden ponerlo en una situación peligrosa.
es.postGameDialog01: Ahora que tenemos suficientes datos climáticos de la Tierra, solo tenemos que verificar su categoría en cada zona climática.
es.postGameDialog02: Ha sido de gran ayuda, pero te necesitamos una vez más para que se adapte correctamente a estos climas.
